definition: to make an issue of sth/to fuss/to make a song and dance

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
chapter/section/clause/movement (of symphony)/seal/badge/regulation/order
surname Zhang

sentences.english: There are some people discriminating the childern born after 1990s to make small to big purposely.
sentences.chinese: 是有些人对90后有歧视，故意大做文章吧？

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: Propaganda must be turned out about the touring of the hills surrounding the Westlake.
sentences.chinese: 西湖深度开发应在四周山岭旅游上做文章。

sentences.english: The Republicans made a great whoop and a hollar about the honesty of federal employees.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人在联邦政府官员的廉洁问题上大做文章。

sentences.english: It is unwise to foster a confrontation over ideological differences.
sentences.chinese: 针对意识形态的不同来大做文章是不明智的。

sentences.english: It created a big fuss and the fuss persists to this day.
sentences.chinese: 它创造了一个大做文章，大惊小怪坚持到今天。

sentences.english: She's quite useful to the media.
sentences.chinese: 她对媒体非常有用，双方都在大做文章。

sentences.english: I think that many people are making exploration on the materials of rice paper and ink.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很多人都是在拿宣纸和墨的材料做文章。

sentences.english: A few tabloid newspapers got hold of this under-the-table gossip.
sentences.chinese: 几家街头小报抓住这些私下闲话大做文章。

sentences.english: Why do you always make a fuss over a trivial things?
sentences.chinese: 只是点风吹草动，你怎么就大做文章？

sentences.english: The Republicans have only just started to point this out.
sentences.chinese: 共和党直到现在才就这个问题开始做文章。

sentences.english: Big consulting companies are also ramping up their data-related practices.
sentences.chinese: 大型咨询公司同样在与数据相关的实践上大做文章。

definition: to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to raise the same topic
see 下工夫[xia4 gong1 fu5]
to play tricks/to cheat/to deceive
amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
moreover/besides
arrogant/to put on airs/(business etc) to expand/to enlarge/to do sth on a big scale
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
to extend the scope/to exaggerate
in short/in a word/in brief
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
place of interest/a place one has one's eye on
to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
